page.title: 10Chailey Commons Society
page.content: In 1962 the North Common was declared a site of special scientific interest because of the number of rare plants to be found there. In 1964 the Clailey Commons Society was formed and in 1966 Chailey Common became the first statutory local nature reserve in East Sussex. The Commons Society meets regularly it hear speakers and to clear the commons of rubbish and scrub. The Society also administers the Garth Christian prize which is awarded to chidlren of the two shools Chailey School and St Peters Primary for outstanding work in enviromental studies. Julie Steel won the Primary School prize in 1985.
